The Structure and Foundation will be designed for most critical combinations of dead loads, live loads, equipment loads, pipe & cable tray loads, crane loads, wind loads, seismic loads, temperature loads and special loads as applicable as per requirement of relevant codes and standards.
6.01 Dead Loads (D) All dead loading will be in accordance with ASCE 7-05 “Minimum Design Loads for Building and Other Structures”.

Dead loads comprise of the weight of structural members and all permanent materials and empty weight of equipment as well as the weight of pipes, air ducts, cables, insulation, and other similar items fastened thereto or supported thereby, which are not considered in the live load, operating load, equipment load, etc., hereinafter.

These Loads will be furnished by Vendor or otherwise will be taken from standard literature.

Vertical impact, lateral and longitudinal forces will be: Vertical impact Monorail cranes (powered) Cab-operated or (powered) remotely operated bridge cranes Pendant-operated bridge cranes (powered) Bridge cranes or monorail cranes with hand-geared bridge, trolley, and hoist Lateral impact force Longitudinal impact force : : : : : : 25% of Maximum Wheel Load 25% of Maximum Wheel Load 10% of Maximum Wheel Load 10% of Maximum Wheel Load 20% of Lifting weight + Trolley weight 10% of Maximum Wheel Load Horizontal load in transverse direction will be distributed to the two rails with due regards to the structural stiffness.

DUQM INTEGRATED POWER & WATER PLANT ("DIPWP") PROJECT DESIGN CRITERIA DOCUMENT - CIVIL, STRUCTURAL AND ARCHITECTURAL AOD10-XW01-U-1040001, REV.A Wind loads on structures are determined in accordance with ASCE 7-05 for the parameters indicated in table 6.3 Table 6.3: Basic wind Parameter for load calculation Basic 3.0 Second Gust wind speed (V) 55 m/s Topographic factor Kzt Occupancy category Importance factor Exposure Category Wind Directionality factor, kd 1.0 III 1.15 C 0.85 Wind loads will be considered from all directions, analytical model will have basic load case for West to east and South to North wind loads.
For enclosed buildings/ Partially enclosed buildings internal pressure and suction cases will be considered for wind from each direction.
In absence of any specific information on the percentage openings in the buildings, the internal pressure coefficient of 0.18 will be considered.
6.07 Seismic Load (Ex and Ez) The Site is exposed to low seismic hazards.
The Site is located on the shore line of the Indian Ocean (Arabian Sea) at the South-East coast of the Arabian Peninsula, identified as the rigid Arabian plate, which is a quiet zone.
Based on this, and considering the UBC category ‘Seismic Zone Zero’, earthquake loads with PGA of minimum 0 to 0.2 m/s2 have to be considered with the design.
The earthquake calculations shall be made in accordance with the latest IBC standard, international standards and Oman standards.
6.08 Temperature Loading (TL) The Design ambient temperature for Structure shall be calculated from “General Site Information” as provided in section 3 of this attachment.

8.05 Handrails Handrail shall be designed to meet OSHA requirements.
Handrail will be prefabricated, double rail type, steel pipe, nominal 40 mm outside diameter.

Handrail shall be ASTM A53 Grade B. Handrail height will be 106 cm from floor, platform, runway, or ramp to upper surface of top rail, with the intermediate rail approximately halfway between top rail and floor.
Stair handrail height will be 86 cm from upper surface of top rail to surface of tread in line with face of the riser at the forward edge of the tread.
Handrail posts will be steel pipe, nominal 40 mm outside diameter, and spaced not more than 1.8 meters on centres.
The anchoring of posts and framing members for handrail must be strong enough to withstand a load of at least 90 kg applied in any direction at any point on the top rail.
Guard plates or toe boards will be 100 mm in vertical height to its top edge from the floor, platform, runway, or ramp with not more than 6 mm clearance above floor level.
8.06 Steel Stairs Stairs shall be designed in accordance with the requirements of OSHA.
Stairs rise height and run width shall be uniform throughout any flight of stairs.

TMT Re-Bars, CRS (Corrosion Resistant Steel) TMT Re-Bars, EQR (Earthquake-resistant) TMT Re-bars and structural steel of medium section.

Since its inception in 1953, SSIL has sailed through various phases of growth and apart from two specialty rolling mills at Howrah, it is the proud owner of two mini integrated steel plants in Durgapur, wherein MS Billets are rolled into TMT bars.
Shyam Steel Manufacturing Limited, having its existing operational facilities at Jemua Mouza, Mejia Block, Distt: Bankura-722143 West Bengal.

Shyam Steel Manufacturing Ltd intends to set up new Steel melt shop of 0.15 MTPA for billets, Light section mill of 0.10 MTPA, captive power plant of 38MW & 1050TPD DRI plant in the existing plant premises.
In order to utilize the hot exhaust gases of the kilns fruitfully.
SHYAM STEEL MANUFACTURINGLIMITED desires to go for 38 MW Captive Power Plant using the Heat available from the 3 nos.

of 350 TPD Kilns and installing WHRB boiler at the kiln exhaust and 1 x 65 TPH CFBC Boiler firing the char generated from the DRI Kilns along with coal to meet the steam requirement for power generation.

ARK Engineering and Power consultants (P) Limited have been retained as the Project Technical Consultants for the design, engineering, manufacture, inspection, installation and commissioning of this proposed Power Plant.
Considering the merits of the EPC execution SHYAM STEEL MANUFACTURING LIMITED has decided to award this tender on Engineering Procurement and Construction (EPC) basis to a single agency.

The EPC scope shall involve the complete design, engineering, procurement, manufacture, inspection, testing, transportation, unloading, storage at site, leading/movement, installation, pre commissioning, commissioning and demonstration of performance guarantee trials of total civil, mechanical, electrical and controls & instrumentation works for the main plant and also the auxiliaries, as required by the detailed specifications enclosed in the subsequent pages, except only those items specifically listed under client‟s scope of supply and responsibility.
However the successful bidder shall provide the complete engineering services for those items which are required for the power plant but listed under client‟s scope of supply and responsibility.

Such Engineering services shall include providing procuring technical specifications for bought out items, design and release of fabrication drawings for the fabrication items and design and release of construction drawings for the civil construction as the case may be.
The main plant and auxiliaries shall be supplied along with the requisite commissioning spares and also the spares required for the 2 Year Operation and maintenance.
The Supplier shall supply a complete set of tools and tackles required for the operation and M/s.

However, in the event of difficulty in adhering to that requirement the Supplier may propose an alternate make for review and approval by client/consultant, substantiating the reasons for the same.
Post order, request for change on the pretext of delivery will not be entertained as it is expressly understood the delivery committed is based on the finalised approved Vendors only.
The detailed technical specifications have been meticulously prepared to include all the details to the maximum extent possible.

However the Supplier shall note that any item or feature not specifically detailed out in the specification but essential for the completeness of the power plant shall be duly included in the scope now itself clearly identifying such inclusions for consideration by the buyer so that there is no implication, whatsoever, to the buyer on a later date.
Supplier to note that any item listed here or in the specification and not listed in scope matrix or vice versa shall be deemed to have been included in both documents.

The Supplier shall pay special attention to the safety aspects required to be adopted and include in the design stage itself all the safety features required in the system for the safe installation and subsequent operation of the power plant.

During the construction stage Supplier shall take utmost care and precaution and practice all methods for highest safety of personnel working for the installation of the power plant as per applicable safety standards as specified elsewhere in the specification.
A Preliminary layout showing locations of the various equipment and buildings of the power plant is forming a part of this specification.

Supplier shall note that while preparing the detailed layout during the contract execution utmost care shall be taken to provide sufficient space around the different equipment and sufficient clearance above any equipment for ease of maintenance and operation of the power plant.
Various equipment buildings shall be sized considering minimum maintenance space of 1.5 m all around the equipment and accordingly the layout shall be planned.
It is entirely the responsibility of the Supplier to plan a neat and convenient layout of the plant equipment and building to the fullest satisfaction of the buyer.
The Turbine rated capacity shall be 38 MW.
Turbine shall be a bleed cum condensing turbine.
There shall be 3 nos of 350 TPD DRI Kiln Exhaust Waste Heat Recovery Boilers and 1 no.
of Circulated fluidized Bed combustion Boiler(CFBC) proposed for the Power plant.
Since the DRI kilns generate lot of waste gases at the kiln exhaust with very high temperatures, the waste heat recovery system is envisaged to recover the waste heat from these exhaust gases.
The CFBC boiler proposed for the power plant shall be suitable for firing Coal & Char.
The combustion system of the boiler shall be Circulated fluidised bed combustor (Over M/s.

The boiler shall be designed to operate continuously at a load of 30% MCR generation and outlet steam temperature shall be maintained constant between 50%to 100% MCR generation.
The fuel handling system shall consist of crushing and screening system.

Coal handling shall be considered for not more than 6 hrs operation (4 hours for Char & 2 hrs for Coal) during any one shift operation in a day and the fuel storage capacity of the fuel bunker shall be for 20 hours.
The conveyors shall be of open Gantry with rain hood, and with oneside platform except specified otherwise.

However at the point of Bend pulley of the Gravity take up arrangement a small walkway/ platform shall be provided on the otherside also with the crossover arrangement for maintenance of bend pulleys.
The fuel handling system shall also include an extended shed over the ground hopper area to accommodate 2 hour storage of coal.
The system shall also include a covered coal storage yard to stack around 30days storage of coal with a stacking height (RCC Wall) of 3.5 m maximum.

Ash collected from the ash hoppers shall be transported to a Separate fly ash silo for WHRB & CFBC through a pneumatic dense phase ash handling system and the CFBC Bed ash shall be transported to a Bed ash silo through a pneumatic dense phase ash handling system.
The dense phase ash handling system shall be designed considering anticipated ash collection during the worst fuel combination.
The system shall include dedicated compressors for the supply of conveying air for the system.
The water treatment system will cater to requirements of both the power cycle makeup and the auxiliary cooling tower makeup.
Existing Raw water storage will be utilized for the proposed the water treatment plant.
The storage capacity of this tank shall be 2000 m3 for power plant excluding fire water storage requirements.
The water treatment plant shall be designed adequately to treat the water as to supply water of acceptable quality and quantity to meet the makeup requirements.

It shall be the sole responsibility of the Supplier to ensure the right selection of the scheme and equipment to achieve the ultimate objective of meeting the makeup water quality requirement so as to maintain the boiler water quality and the cooling water quality at acceptable levels.
It shall also be the responsibility of the Supplier to demonstrate the boiler water quality parameters too as spelt out for the boiler by the supplier.

All exposed portions of the plant which operate at a temperature of 60° and above during normal operation shall be thermally insulated so that the temperature on the outer surface does not exceed more than 20°C above ambient.
Piping and equipment that are not insulated, but having the surface temperature more than 50°C shall be insulated for personnel protection in all the accessible areas.
The service air and instrument air requirements of the power plant shall be met by dedicated service air cum instrument air compressors of suitable capacities and of appropriate pressures.
Two numbers of air driers shall be provided to achieve the requisite dew point as required by the instruments offered for the plant.

The power generated from this plant shall be evacuated as per the electrical single line diagram which forms a part of this specification.
All electrical equipment shall comply with IEEE recommendations, as listed elsewhere in the specification.

The synchronous generator shall generate power at 11 kV and all plant distribution loads shall be 415 V. The generator shall have CACW cooling and shall have class F insulation and temperature rise limited to clause B insulation limits.
Insulation class for all the drives shall be class F with temperature rise restricted to class B.
All the relays applicable for the HT and LT switchboards and the Generator protection relays shall be numerical relays with RS 485 communication on MODBUS protocol.
Cable sizing shall be based on the fault current of the system for 25 seconds.

The plant instrumentation and control system, including that of air compressors and ash handling system, shall be based on Distributed Control System Philosophy and will be designed to provide monitoring and control capabilities to ensure safe and reliable operation of the power plant from the central control room, minimize operator manual actions and alert operators as to any conditions or situation requiring manual intervention in a timely manner.
Generally the entire plant operation shall be considered through DCS.
In general the DCS shall have redundancy at the power supply, communication and processor levels.
The status of all the analog and digital instruments and all drives in the power plant shall be made available in the DCS through DIRECT input to the DCS.

All the microprocessor based relays, ESP TR set controllers, Temperature scanners, Governor, Trivector meters etc shall be hooked upto the DCS on modbus through RS 485 for monitoring from the central control room.
All I & C equipment will be of proven design and will be selected to achieve highest level of plant availability and facilitate equipment maintenance.

Load shedding system (NOT REQUIRED but provision for power management system) 5.34.36.1.
A separate load shedding system shall be designed, supplied and implemented.
Following is the brief description of the same.
System shall continuously monitor generation sources, grid incomer and outgoing consumer feeders at 11 kV bus level for any major variation in megawatt range or wild fluctuation in frequency.
EPC supplier, in close coordination with owner / consultant shall assign priorities to various feeders.

The load shedding system shall continuously evaluate the power flow on 11 kV bus and decide the priorities to shad the load in case of major fluctuation on load side, generation side or major fluctuation in frequency.
High speed numerical relays for df / dt application shall be used.

In the event of emergency, the load shedding system shall shut off the feeders based on priority assigned to them such that source of generation and consumption on 11 kV are balanced and frequency is maintained at 50 Hz.
The response time of the system shall be very fast and less than 100 msec to ensure that load shedded effectively before the collapse of 11 kV bus.
Dedicated load shedding systems from reputed supplier shall be considered.

The ranges of the instruments shall be selected based on the following philosophy indicated below: For pressure and draft measurements, the maximum operating pressure will be within 70 to 80% of the maximum scale range.

For temperature measurement, the maximum operating temperature will be within 80 to 90% of the maximum scale range.
For pressure switches and temperature switches, the set points shall fall within 40% to 70% of the scale range selected.
For level measurement, the maximum of the range will cover the overflow point or six inches from the top of the vessel and the minimum of the range will be six inches above the bottom of the vessel.

For flow measurement, the maximum range shall be fixed at about 10 to 15% above the maximum operating flow.

Operation Philosophy The Battery Charger system shall have two Float cum Boost chargers.
Both chargers shall be of identical design and rating.
The battery to be connected to the chargers shall be of VRLA type as indicated in the data sheet.
Battery Chargers for VRLA batteries shall be sized to provide Boost charging of the battery within duration of 10 hours, unless specified otherwise.
Normal operation requires that the battery assembly shall be float charged by float charger and other will be in standby mode, if main charger fails the standby charger will start automatically.
In case of failure of either of the chargers, the other charger shall float charge the battery while feeding the complete DC load.
In case of AC mains failure, the battery shall continue to supply the load.

On resumption of AC mains supply if the battery is in discharged condition & both chargers are healthy, one charger pre-selected by selector switch shall boost charge the battery & the other shall supply the load.

Interlock shall be provided to ensure that when either of the chargers is selected in Boost charging mode, it will be disconnected from both the DC load and the other charger shall operate in float charging mode.
The changeover from float to Boost charging and reverting from Boost to float charging shall be selectable by means of an Auto/ Manual selector switch.
In Automatic mode, the changeover from float to boost charging shall be initiated through a current sensor, set at a preset value.
Similarly, the changeover from Boost to float charging shall also be automatic based on current sensing.
In Manual mode, both changeovers from float to boost charging and from Boost to float charging shall be performed manually using push buttons / selector switch.

Class A Trip: Class A group shall operate on all electrical faults which need the complete shutdown of both the turbine and generator simultaneously and instantaneously.
When Class A is tripped.
It initiates instantaneous tripping of Class B also.

Class B Trip: In this mode of tripping, the turbine is shut down first and the generator is tripped subsequently by the reverse power relays.
This is to ensure that the unit does not over speed on tripping due to the trapped steam in the turbine.
This mode of tripping is adopted for all mechanical faults and non-critical electrical faults, which are considered safe to afford the time delay.
Class-C Trip: In this mode of tripping the generator is isolated from the CPP by tripping the incoming Grid feeder breaker for faults beyond the generator system.
In this case, the unit continues to run supplying auxiliary plant load.
For Class C trip of any if the two generator shall isolate CPP system from the Grid by tripping incomer Grid Breaker.

INTRODUCTION 1.1 Purpose of Document The purpose of this document is to establish a basis for the design of Civil, Structural and Architectural items for the 100k BPD Topping Refinery in Fujairah in the UAE.
This document shall be further updated during detailed design phase.
This criteria is intended to be a guide for design of related structures with the objective that the same will be built to satisfy functional requirements and be serviceable, economical and safe.
Engineering judgments shall be exercised in applying these to a particular structure.

1.2 Project Background FLOREXX (COMPANY) has signed a contract with SNC-Lavalin International Inc. (CONTRACTOR) to provide an EBED and an EPC Lump Sum cost estimate Proposal for their 100k BPD Topping Refinery in Fujairah in the UAE.

Forces on vertical vessels, horizontal vessels, or heat exchangers caused by the thermal expansion of the pipe attached to the vessel.
Self-straining thermal forces caused by the restrained expansion of horizontal vessels, heat exchangers, and structural members in pipe racks or in structures.
Pipe rack friction forces caused by the sliding of pipes or friction forces caused by the sliding of horizontal vessels or heat exchangers on their supports, in response to thermal expansion.

Details and requirements for the slotted connection and special bolting procedures to ensure the connection can slip fully shall be detailed on the engineering drawings.
Lateral stability shall be achieved by moment resisting connections or bracing.
Longitudinal stability shall be achieved by knee braces or braced bays.
In areas where gravity loading of struts is anticipated, struts shall be designed for axial loads produced by longitudinal pipe loads plus gravity load moments and shears.
Such struts should be designed for the actual load but not less than 50% of the gravity loading of the loaded transverse pipe support beam.
This loading requirement will account for the usual piping and electrical conduit that is "rolled-out" of the pipe rack.
Concentrated loads for large pipes shall also be included in design.
Where gravity loading is not anticipated, longitudinal struts shall be designed for axial load only.
The primary source of axial loads is longitudinal pipe loads.

Definitions of drainage network The following definitions shall be used:                   Headers are sewer lines connecting manhole to manhole and carrying combined effluents from collectors and/or sub-collectors; Collectors are sewer lines collecting the effluent from two or more sub-collectors discharging to manholes on mains; Sub-collectors are sewer branches collecting effluent from individual inlets such as drains and catch basins; Drains are small sewer inlets/interconnections (such as an open end pipe or fitting) discharging through a sealed connection to the sewer system from discrete sources, such as pump bases, equipment drips, low points of floors, but not from outside surface drainage; Open channel floor or pavement drains are continuous troughs or trenches collecting surface drainage discharging to the sewer system; Catch basins are used to collect surface drainage and process wastes individual drainage areas and to trap sediments at the point nearest of the source; Catchment Area served for water system by receiving storm water or fire water integral sediment trap; Manholes are used in sewers as junction points and sediment traps and to provide access for maintenance and inspection; Seals (minimum 150 mm hydraulic) are used to prevent vapor emission out of inlets and to isolate the various parts of a sewer system preventing vapor travel and spread of fire or explosion; Kerbed areas are with raised curbs which control spillage and drainage of storm, process and fire water; Vents are pipes open to the atmosphere to prevent blowing of seals by pressure buildup.

Cable trenches in paved areas shall be provided in accordance with project standard drawings.

8.9 Thermal /Friction Loads, (T) Thermal Loads are categorized as follows: Tp = T = Af = Ff = Pipe anchor and guide forces.
Forces on vertical vessels, horizontal vessels, or heat exchangers caused by the thermal expansion of the pipe attached to the vessel.
Self-straining thermal forces caused by the restrained expansion of horizontal vessels, heat exchangers, and structural members in pipe racks or in structures.
Pipe rack friction forces caused by the sliding of pipes or friction forces caused by the sliding of horizontal vessels or heat exchangers on their supports, in response to thermal expansion.
All support structures and elements thereof shall be designed to accommodate the loads or effects produced by thermal expansion and contraction of equipment, piping and the structure itself.
Thermal loads shall be included with operating loads in the appropriate load combinations.
Thermal load shall have the same load factor as dead load.
Anchor Forces (Af): Anchor force during operation shall be considered as permanent and will be considered as per the piping load input from piping stress analysis.
Pipe rack beams, struts, columns, braced anchor frames, and foundations shall be designed to resist actual pipe anchor and guide loads.

Friction load (Ff): The Thermal Load is the force occurring due to thermal expansion or contraction of the materials of the structure, the force occurring at piping and equipment anchor points, and the sliding or rolling friction forces due to thermal expansion or contraction.

Bracing members shall be provided, that do not interfere with piping, operation and maintenance.
All pipe racks shall be constructed using structural steel.
Concrete pipe racks are not permitted.
Connection of foundation and column base of steel structure can be assumed as only fixity about the major axis.
For pipe rack design, provisions shall be made for thermal expansion of steel, with the structural steel checked for temperature change.
Slotted connections (sliding connection / Expansion joints) shall be provided in each segment of the pipe rack (at end of segment) to allow for structural steel thermal expansion.
The maximum segment for the pipe rack shall be limited to 40 to 60 m (preferably 42 meters) in length and a minimum of one braced bay shall be provided within this segment.
The location of each braced bay should be approximately centered between the expansions joints along the length of the pipe rack.
Details and requirements for the slotted connection and special bolting procedures to ensure the connection can slip fully shall be detailed on the engineering drawings.
Lateral stability shall be achieved by moment resisting connections or bracing.
Longitudinal stability shall be achieved by knee braces or braced bays.
In areas where gravity loading of struts is anticipated, struts shall be designed for axial loads produced by longitudinal pipe loads plus gravity load moments and shears.
Such struts should be designed for the actual load but not less than 50% of the gravity loading of the loaded transverse pipe support beam.
This loading requirement will account for the usual piping and electrical conduit that is "rolled-out" of the pipe rack.
Concentrated loads for large pipes shall also be included in design.
Where gravity loading is not anticipated, longitudinal struts shall be designed for axial load only.
The primary source of axial loads is longitudinal pipe loads.

12.7 Requirements of Machine Foundations Machine foundations shall satisfy the following requirements in general, unless specified otherwise.
1) Concrete grade for foundations / superstructures shall be controlled concrete of grade C30, or higher.
2) All units of the foundation system, except foundation raft shall be provided with symmetric reinforcement on opposite faces, even if it is not required by design considerations.
3) The soil stress below heavy machine foundations under dead loads shall not exceed 50% of the allowable soil bearing capacity, or safe load on pile, for static loading.

4) The combined centre of gravity of the machine and foundation system shall, as far as possible, pass through the centre of area of the foundation raft or centroid of the pile group (In case of pile foundations).
Where unavoidable, eccentricity shall be less than 5% for block foundations, and 3% for frame foundations.
However, in highly compressible soils, no eccentricity shall be permitted.
5) Foundations shall be so designed that natural frequency of the foundation system shall not resonate with the following: (a) Operating speed of the machine.
(b) Two times the operating speed of the machine.
(This condition shall be complied only when the manufacturer has furnished the unbalance forces related to two times the operating speed of the machine.
In case of machines having different operating speeds of gear and drive, the operating speed of machine only may be considered for avoiding resonance.
Natural frequency of the foundation shall preferably be ± 20% away from the above mentioned frequencies.
However, amplitude to be within permissible limits.
(c) Amplitude of vibration shall be less than values specified by the machine manufacturer.
(d) The foundation and its superstructure shall be separated from adjacent foundations and platforms.
Clear air gap shall be provided in superstructure to avoid transmission of vibration to adjacent structures.
Special note shall be given on the drawing in this respect, and suitable details shall be shown as required.
(e) Foundations resting partly on rock and partly on soil shall preferably be avoided.
However, if unavoidable, the soil area shall be replaced by blind concrete C20, or as per the geo-technical recommendations.
(f) Foundations shall not rest on previously backfilled or sensitive soils.

Definitions of drainage network The following definitions shall be used:                   Headers are sewer lines connecting manhole to manhole and carrying combined effluents from collectors and/or sub-collectors; Collectors are sewer lines collecting the effluent from two or more sub-collectors discharging to manholes on mains; Sub-collectors are sewer branches collecting effluent from individual inlets such as drains and catch basins; Drains are small sewer inlets/interconnections (such as an open end pipe or fitting) discharging through a sealed connection to the sewer system from discrete sources, such as pump bases, equipment drips, low points of floors, but not from outside surface drainage; Open channel floor or pavement drains are continuous troughs or trenches collecting surface drainage discharging to the sewer system; Catch basins are used to collect surface drainage and process wastes individual drainage areas and to trap sediments at the point nearest of the source; Catchment Area served for water system by receiving storm water or fire water integral sediment trap; Manholes are used in sewers as junction points and sediment traps and to provide access for maintenance and inspection; Seals (minimum 150 mm hydraulic) are used to prevent vapor emission out of inlets and to isolate the various parts of a sewer system preventing vapor travel and spread of fire or explosion; Kerbed areas are with raised curbs which control spillage and drainage of storm, process and fire water; Vents are pipes open to the atmosphere to prevent blowing of seals by pressure buildup.
Chemical sewer: Collects acid, caustic or other chemical waste which shall be neutralized or treated before discharge to industrial sewer.
Combined sewer: Common sewer system collecting both process oily water and storm water.
Contaminated water: Storm water that has come into contact with any raw material, intermediate / finished / by-product or waste product.
Clean out: Piping connection in sewer system located at grade level for inspecting or cleaning the system.
Drain hub/funnel: An opening in pipe connection in sewer system located at grade level to collect drips or discharge from pump bases, piping, sample draw of point & equipment drain.
Sub-lateral connect drain hub to sealed connection in manhole.
It is fitted with conical inlet with narrow pipe outlet.
Laterals: Drains collecting waste water from two or more drain hubs & discharging into main header.
Oily water: Waste water generated during industrial process that contains oil, emulsified oil or other hydrocarbon.
Accidentally Contaminated water collected during rainfall situation or emergency fire situation.

Fire protection provisions Unless otherwise specified or agreed with the Owner, the following design principles should be observed as minimum fire prevention requirements: Pipeline insulation and the infills of cable and pipeline wall penetrations are to be of non- combustible material.
All pipelines or vessels with internal temperatures of more than 180 °C shall be so arranged as to avoid any contact with flammable liquids if fuel or lube oil lines should leak.
Sufficient physical separation shall be ensured.
Particular care should be taken to eliminate any risk of hot pipeline-insulating material becoming impregnated with flammable liquids in the case of fuel or lube oil line leakage.
The insulation is to be covered in its entirety, with an oil resistant sheet, over which the cladding is to be fitted.
Cable and pipeline ducts must be so arranged and sealed as to avoid any risk of flooding with, lube oil or any other flammable liquid.

In addition to sealing the cable and pipeline ducts, the cable basements must be completely sealed against leakage from above as well, in order to preclude the ingress of lube oil or other flammable liquids.
Covered floor ducts must be easily accessible for inspection and cleaning.
All parts of plant and equipment are to be arranged so that no corners or pits that would be difficult to inspect and clean and in which flammable matter could collect are formed.
Fuel preheating temperatures should be limited to a margin of at least 10 K below the fuel flash point.
Lubricating oil lines in the turbine-generator lube oil system are not to be connected with compression-type joints but rather with welded or screwed-type points.
Non-combustible materials which do not release noxious or toxic fumes must be used for wall and ceiling paneling, for floor covering, and for cubicles and cabinets.

(a) White metal blast cleaning: Sa 3 or SSPC - SP 5 Sa 3 Blast cleaning to bare metal.
Mill scale, rust and foreign matter must be removed completely.
Subsequently, the surface is cleaned with vacuum cleaner, clean dry compressed air or a clean brush.
It must then have a uniform metallic colour and correspond in appearance to the prints designated Sa 3.
(b) Near white metal blast cleaning Sa 2 1/2 or SSPC - SP 10 Sa 2 1/2.
Very thorough blast cleaning.
Mill scale, rust and foreign matter shall be removed to the extent that the only traces remaining are slight imperfections in the form of spots or stripes.
Subsequently, the surface is cleaned with a vacuum cleaner, clean dry compressed air or a clean brush.
It must then correspond in appearance to the prints designated sa 2 1/2.
Mechanical cleaning should only be used when procedures (a) and (b) are not practicable.
(c) Commercial Blast Cleaning Sa 2 Blast cleaning until atleast two-thirds of each element of surface area is free of all visible residues.
This method of Blasing is suitable for steel required to be painted with conventional paints for exposure to mildly corrosive atmosphere for longer life of the paint systems.
(d) Near white metal blast cleaning P Sa 2 1/2 DIN 55928 Very thorough blast cleaning.
Very adhesive coatings remain.
From all other surface mill scale and rust are to be removed to such an extent that the only traces remaining are slight imperfections in the form of spots or stripes.

13.13.0 Galvanizing All galvanising shall be carried out by the hot dip process (and unless otherwise specified shall conform in all respects with BS EN ISO 1461 and BS EN 10143 or equivalent international standard).
Attention shall be paid to the detail design of structural members (in accordance with BS4479 or equivalent international standard).
Adequate provision for filling, venting and draining shall be made for assemblies fabricated from hollow sections.
Vent holes shall be suitably plugged after galvanising.
All surface defects in the steel including cracks, surface laminations, lumps and folds shall be removed (in accordance with BS 7668 or equivalent international standard).
All drilling, cutting, welding, forming and final fabrications of unit members and assemblies shall be completed before the structures are galvanised.
The surface of the steelwork to be galvanised shall be free from welding slag, paint, oil grease and similar contaminants.
The minimum average coating weight shall be as per BS EN ISO 1461 or equivalent international standard.

Structural steel items shall be initially grit blasted to BS 7079 or equivalent international standard, second quality (Sa 2½) and the minimum average coating weight on steel sections 5mm thick and over shall be 915 g/m2.
On removal from the galvanising bath the resultant coating shall be smooth, continuous, free from gross surface imperfections such as bare spots, lumps, blisters and inclusions of flux, ash or dross.
Galvanised contact surfaces to be joined by high strength friction grip bolts shall be roughened before assembly so that the required slip factor is achieved.
Care shall be taken to ensure that the roughening is confined to the net area of the mating surfaces.
The cable trays, supports and steel structures for cabling shall be electro galvanised (sendzimir galvanised) sheet steel according to DIN 17166 or BS EN 10143.

Bolts, nuts and washers, excluding general grade high strength friction grip bolts shall be hot dip galvanised and subsequently centrifuged (according to BS EN ISO 1461 or equivalent international standard).
Nuts shall be retapped after galvanised and the threads oiled to permit the nuts to be finger turned on the bolt for the full depth of the nut.

No lubricants, applied to the projecting threads of a galvanised high strength friction-grip bolt after the bolt has been inserted through the steelwork, shall be allowed to come into contact with the mating surfaces.
During off loading and erection the use of nylon slings shall be used.
Galvanised work, which is to be stored in works or on site shall be stacked so as to provide adequate ventilation to all surfaces to avoid wet storage staining (white rust).

Environmental protection design for the power project will be based on the requirements of environmental impact report and relevant stipulations, and state of the art, proven technology will be adopted.
This will guarantee that the plant will run in a safe, efficient manner and with high availability, and satisfy the demands of protecting the environment.
The air emissions of the plant will meet the Pollution control board norms and guidelines.
The plant effluent shall also meet the stipulations laid down by Pollution control board.
The general pollution control board (PCB) requirements shall be imposed.
Any add-on requirements during public hearing and EC shall be imposed as amendment.

Atmosphere Pollution Prevention and Control The Steam generator shall be equipped with efficient Electro Static Precipitators (ESP) with a capacity of at least 99.9% dust removal, FGD Plant for Sox removal & DeNOx system.

The ambient air quality within the power project premises shall strictly conform to the Central Pollution Control Board (CPCB) as well as State Pollution Control Board norms(State PCB) & requirements.
No deviation/correction in this regard is acceptable.

21.3.3 Water Pollution Prevention and Control 21.3.4 The plant should be designed to economize on water use and to set up a water management system featuring equilibrium between water feed and water discharge.
 Waste water (including all effluents, acid and alkali waste, oily waste, Blow down, etc.)
from the plant shall be treated in distributed mode and will reach the standards before it is discharged.
Plant water pollution shall meet the State PCB and CPCB Norms and requirements.
No Deviation/correction in this regard is acceptable.
Sewage disposal shall conform to the State PCB and CPCB Norms and requirements.
No Deviation/correction in this regard is acceptable.
 The plant shall be designed for zero discharge for raw water based effluents.

All plant effluents such as from DM plant, service water, sewage, etc., shall be treated for reuse to ensure zero discharge Noise Pollution Prevention and Control The Contractor shall take all necessary measures for noise attenuation in order to meet the specified noise levels.
Noise pollution shall meet the State PCB and CPCB Norms and requirements.
All equipment shall be specified for a design to run without undue vibration and with the least amount of noise.
General requirements of noise control: The noise level shall meet the MoEF and State PCB environmental requirements specified for the project.

The entire plant shall be designed, operated and maintained in such a way to prevent any soil contamination and adequate provisions shall be made in the design.
Rainwater Harvesting The rain water collected from the roof of buildings shall be channelized through the rain water down comers and routed to the garland drain around the buildings.

4.0.0 DESIGN REQUIREMENT 4.1.0 4.2.0 4.3.0 4.4.0 4.5.0 4.6.0 4.7.0 4.8.0 4.9.0 4.10.0 4.11.0 The steam generator shall be Circulating Fluidized Bed Combustion (CFBC) type, single drum, non-reheat, naturally circulated, with water cooled membrane wall, semi-outdoor type unit.
Steam generator shall be designed for the range of fuel (coal & process gas) specified in General Technical Specification.
The steam generator shall be designed to limit total un- burnt carbon in fly ash to be less than 5%.
The steam generator shall be designed to generate 250 TPH rated capacity of superheated steam at 110 ata and 540 ± 5ºC at 210ºC feed water temperature.
The rated capacity shall be achieved even at both HP heaters out conditions.
The steam generator shall be designed for balanced draft operation.
The complete pressure part system of boiler, piping & valves, design shall fully comply with the Indian Boiler Regulations (IBR).
The requirements specified are the minimum design and sizing requirements for the steam generator and its auxiliaries.

Contractor's utilization of various values and requirements indicated in this specification shall in no way relieve the Contractor of his responsibilities to meet all guarantee requirements or of providing completely safe and reliable operating equipment’s/ systems.

The specified requirements shall be complied for the most stringent conditions resulting either from the range of coals specified or from the range of operating conditions specified (like 100% BMCR and HP heater out conditions), unless otherwise specifically mentioned by the Owner.
Typical characteristics of specified range of coals/ limestone such as high abrasive, slow burning, high ash resistivity etc.
shall be given due consideration while designing Steam generator and its auxiliaries.

The design of Steam Generator shall comply with the design requirements set out in this section and also meet the requirements specified in specified Design Data Thermal calculation, all fan sizing calculation, all pump sizing calculation and thickness calculation shall be provided.
The equipment’s and auxiliaries shall be suitable for continuous operation in the frequency range of 47.5 Hz to 51.5 Hz.

Special consideration shall be given for all critical areas on pressure parts, over all arrangement and layout for convenient access for regular operation and ease of maintenance.
The complete system of pressure parts shall be of seamless construction conforming to ASTM code / specification.
The thickness of pressure parts and materials to be used shall be subjected to approval of consultant.

To the extent possible, the pressure part system and components shall be drainable type (except superheater).
Boiler Drum The steam drum shall be of fusion welded type, provided with manholes at each end, arranged to open inwards.

The water storage capacity in the steam drum, between normal operating level to the trip level shall be sufficient to run the unit for a minimum of 1.0 minute, at 100% MCR evaporation rate, with feed water flow to unit stopped.
The drum internals shall be of the proven type to limit the solids carry over.
Baffle type driers shall be in 2 stages (minimum) and shall be of bolted type for easy removal.
Liberally sized downcomer system shall be adopted to feed water to the water wall headers.

Water Wall System (Combustor Section) The complete furnace combustor section, including all the fluid bed proper wall sections shall be fabricated with welded wall type panel construction to ensure structural rigidity, ease of erection, inspection and repair etc when required.
The furnace dimension shall be chosen conservatively keeping in view optimum arrangement of combustion section.
Welded wall / Membrane wall type furnace construction only will be acceptable, to ensure a gas and pressure tight envelope.

Superheater System The superheater system shall preferably combine the radiant and convective surfaces, to achieve the rated steam temperature as specified in the design basis, from 60% to 100% MCR load condition.
In case of CFBC design in which all SH surfaces are in convection zone, flue gas parameters at 60% load also shall be provided.
The SH tube materials shall have minimum thickness of 4.5 mm.

Contractor shall furnish for all stages of SH, for each thickness, size & material of the tube used - the rated steam temperature, rated steam pressure, maximum tube metal temperature calculated and actual thickness provided.

The fuel bunker shall be designed for 24 hrs storage considering worst coal.

1.6 mm stainless steel lining on conical portion of bunker walls shall be adopted to fill bunker to required height in order to ensure smooth flow of coal from the bunkers, for assured fuel flow and to prevent any hang up and plugging.

DESIGN REQUIREMENTS The pumps and auxiliaries shall be designed, manufactured, tested and supplied strictly in accordance with the codes and standard.
All requirements specified in the following paragraphs are addition/modification to the above standards.
Boiler Feed Water Pumps Design Criteria Capacity of each pump shall meet the requirements indicated in the pump data sheet enclosed at the end of this specification.
Consistent with good operating characteristics and high efficiency, the feed pumps shall have a continuously rising head capacity characteristic from design point to shut off.
The flow of boiler feed pumps shall have 10% margin over feed flow corresponding to boiler BMCR condition with 3 % makeup and corresponding head.
10% margin on equipment and piping pressure drop at BMCR condition with 3% make-up shall be considered while arriving the TDH at design point.
Special care shall be taken about NPSH requirements of the pumps.

when the total dynamic head has dropped by 3%) shall be 0.555 or less times the available NPSH.

Pumps shall be so designed to enable a quick start-up of the pump (i.e.)
without the necessity of installing a warm-up system.
Pump drives will be designed for automatic start (of the standby) with the discharge valve in wide open condition (VWO).

All parts must be capable of accepting the loads occurring due to rapid load and temperature variation and also those occurring due to start-up, shut-down and continuous base load operation without limitation and without affecting the planned life.
In so far as the special requirements given below for the individual parts of the plant also apply to other parts of the steam turbine plant, they are to be used there as applicable.
Boiler Feed water pumps (BFP) The feed pumps shall be of heavy duty indoor type suitable for long periods of uninterrupted service.
Anchor bolts, nuts and supporting steel work shall be supplied with the equipment.
Only hexagonal nuts shall be used for holding down the equipment.
All bolt holes shall be spot faced for nuts.
The equipment shall be designed to permit interchangeability of parts and ease of access during inspection, maintenance and repair.
All parts subjected to substantial temperature changes shall be designed and supported to permit free expansion and contraction without resulting in leakage, harmful distortion or misalignment.
All pressure containing components including the pump casing, nozzles and stuffing box housing shall be designed, fabricated and tested in accordance with the ASME Sec VIII Div.
I - Code for Unfired Pressure Vessels or equivalent.

All electrical and mechanical equipment shall be designed and manufactured so that no change will result from transportation and storage, installation and operation of the equipment under the climatic conditions to which it will be subjected.
All materials used shall conform to specifications and shall be new.
Castings and forgings shall conform to their respective material specifications and shall be free from flaws and objectionable imperfections, machined true and of high grade workmanship.

Proposals for repair or any similar operations involving plugging, welding, boring or addition of metal to the original castings or forgings shall be submitted to the Owner / Consultant and his approval shall be received before any such work is carried out.

The separate components of equipment shall be marked with suitable reference numbers or symbols, which shall also be indicated on the assembly drawings too and in their identification & assembly at site.
Casing The main boiler feed pumps shall be of horizontal ring section type centrifugal pump & design with both suction and discharge nozzles on top, pointing upwards.
The pump motor & assembly will be of direct coupled type only (without gear box).
The casing, suction and discharge nozzles shall be capable of withstanding the usual moments and thrusts from the connecting piping without the requirement of expansion joints.
The casing may be double volute or diffuser design, assuring radial balance and equal temperature distribution at all steady state and transient load conditions.

The pumps shall be so designed and the sequence of various stages shall be such that leakage at the running joints shall be minimum over a long period of time and mechanical seals shall be subject to the lowest pressure in the pumps.
The casing shall be designed with internal clearances for the rotating elements, facilitating ease of assembly without resorting to close clearance adjustments.
The running clearances shall meet the requirements of API-610.
The casing shall be provided with dowels for accurate re-assembly after dismantling.
Pump suction and discharge nozzles shall be provided with flange connections to standard ANSI B 16.5.
Impeller & Shaft The impellers shall be cast in one piece, finished all over and carefully balanced both statically and dynamically at all operating speeds.
Finally, the assembled rotor shall be dynamically balanced in all planes and checked for eccentricity.
The shafts shall be machined from bar forgings, heat treated and ground all over.
Bearing and Lubrication Radial and thrust bearings shall be anti-friction type under the conditions mentioned in API-610.
Thrust bearings shall be sized for continuous operation under all specified conditions.
Anti-friction bearings shall be retained on the shaft and fitted into housings in accordance with the requirements of AFBMA Standard 7.

The Auxiliary cooling tower is required to cool continuously, throughout the year, the hot water returning from cooling equipment of the TG auxiliaries and boiler auxiliaries.

The construction of basin shall be of R.C.C casing and fan stack of FRP.

The basin shall be common for all cells and shall be provided with partition walls for isolation.
Each compartment shall be sloped to facilitate draining/cleaning of basin.
A suitable sump shall be provided in each compartment of the basin to facilitate draining of the basin with the use of a portable dewatering pump.
Nozzle 150 mm NB with an isolation valve and blind flange (with bolts, nuts etc.)
shall be provided for dewatering.

2.0.0 DESIGN REQUIREMENTS i.

The inclination of conveyors above the ground level shall not exceed 14 degree for crushed coal (-6mm).
The conveyor shall be horizontal at the feed point as far as possible.
In case the same is not possible, the inclination at the feed point shall be limited to 6 degree.
Routing of conveyors at ground level shall be avoided except at feed point of conveyors and for yard conveyors.
Clear headroom of 8m shall be maintained at the road crossing and other areas.
iii.
The artificial coefficient of friction shall be considered as 0.03 for calculating the belt tension and power requirement for conveyors.
iv.
Idlers Carrying Idlers and impact idlers shall be three roll, 35 degrees troughing angle for carrying side and return idlers shall be single roll flat type for return side for all belt conveyors.
The idler bearings shall be totally sealed and lubricated for life deep groove ball bearings with multiple labyrinth seals for protection.
The side brackets of idlers shall be of pressed ‘C’ type.
The idler frames shall be constructed so that roll can be readily removed and replaced.
Slotted bolt holes shall be provided on the idler frame for attaching to the stringers.
Idler frames shall be designed to prevent accumulation of coal on the members.
The brackets of the return idlers shall be designed such that the return rollers do not jump out.
Conveyor idlers, below the magnetic separators shall be of non-magnetic material (stainless steel).
Carrying and return idlers spacing at the convex and concave curves shall be half of the normal spacing on the straight conveyors.

Transition idlers shall be similar in construction to the carrying idler except that, both side rolls shall be adjustable and set at suitable inclination but less than the standard toughing idler inclination.
Impact idlers shall be similar in construction to troughing carrying idlers except rolls shall consist of sufficient number of closely spaced natural rubber discs designed for cushioning effect.
The than 25 mm.
The rubber shall have durometer hardness of 55 to 65 shore, scale A.
Impact idlers shall be placed at 300mm distance at the feeding zone.
rubber at highest point shall not be thickness of less Carrying idlers shall be placed at 500mm distance within the skirt board length apart from the feeding zone.
Wobble tolerance idlers with +/-0.2mm shall be provided below the belt weigher for better weighing accuracy.
One self-cleaning type rubber disc return idler located near the head pulley for cleaning return belt shall be provided.

The training idlers shall be pivot mounted, positive action type.
Minimum roll diameter of the idler shall be 114.3 mm and minimum shaft diameter shall be 20 mm.

Maximum spacing shall be 1200 mm for carrying idlers and 3000 mm for return idlers v. Pulley Pulleys shall be normally of welded steel construction with continuous rim and two end discs fitted with steel hubs.
Extra wide pulleys shall be fitted with intermediate disc for stiffening.
Hubs shall be keyed to the shaft and shall be positively secured against lateral movement on shaft.
The construction shall be such that easy removal of shaft from pulley is possible.
Diameter of pulley shall be selected to ensure proper torque transmission and low belt fatigue.
All pulleys shall be MS construction and statically balanced.
Shell thickness for pulleys shall be minimum 10mm.
Thickness of rubber lagging shall be 10 mm herring bone type for drive and 8 mm plain type for non-drive pulleys.
The shore hardness for the rubber lagging shall be minimum 65±5 on scale ‘A’.
The face width of the pulleys shall be considered as Belt width + 200mm for conveyors having belt speed upto 3m/sec: The shafts of pulleys shall be of C-40 or better.
The deflection slope of pulley shaft at bearings shall not exceed 6 minutes under load condition.
Single snub with wrap angle 210° shall be considered for design of conveyors.
All drive pulley shafts shall be supported on heavy duty, horizontal split type Plummer blocks.
The pulleys below inline magnetic separators shall have shell of non magnetic SS-304.
The plumber block shall be split type,dust tight with double labyrinth seals.
Suitable guards shall be provided for all pulleys.
vi.
Belting Fire Resistance grade covers shall be considered for all CONVEYORS.
Fire resistant property shall conform to Canadian Bureau of Mines Report No.
FRL–269 and Flame retardation test conforming to ISO-340.
The belting shall be of Nylon-Nylon.
The cover shall be natural or synthetic rubber.
Number of plies shall be minimum 3.
The minimum cover thickness shall be 5 mm at the top and 2 mm at the bottom.
Factor of safety shall be considered as minimum 10.

Maximum belt sag shall be 2% between idlers.
Conveyor belts shall be joined by hot vulcanizing.
Minimum spacing between two splices shall be 200 m. The contractor shall include in his supply sufficient length of belt to take care of field splicing.
The belt shall have enough edge rubber anchorage to resist and wear.
vii.

shall be as per relevant Indian standards.
The belt conveyors shall be equipped with suitable tensioning devices.

The DES shall extract coal dust at coal discharge point in each bunker and from individual bunkers during bunker ventilation and collect it at bag filter.

2.0.0 SYSTEM DESCRIPTION 2.1.0 BED Ash Handling Bed ash is formed due to combustion of coal in the CFBC boiler.
Below each bed ash cooler outlet, adequately sized water-jacketed surge hopper shall be provided to reduce the ash temperature below 150 degree Celsius.
Ash collected in the surge hopper shall be extracted sequentially and conveyed using pneumatically up to bed ash silo (by Others) for storage and further disposal.
The ash from the hopper shall be discharged into the transmitter vessel by gravity.
Required flow of compressed air shall be supplied at the transmitter vessel to convey ash to the storage silo.
The conveying air shall be vented to atmosphere through bag filter / vent filter mounted on silo top.
Normally the ash evacuation shall be done continuously for 8 hours in a shift.
The system shall be sized such that bed ash generated in 8 hours can be evacuated in 4 hours.
The air compressor sizing and the pipeline sizing shall be done to suit the same.
In case of any maintenance on the system the evacuation can be done for 4 hours in a shift of eight (8) hours.
Dry bed ash shall be collected in RCC silo having adequate storage capacity (48 hrs of ash generation) from where dry bed ash shall be unloaded into open/closed trucks for ash utilization facilities.
Contractor to ensure zero leakage of ash while designing bed ash handling system.
2.2.0 Fly Ash Handling System Pressure type pneumatic conveying system shall be provided to evacuate fly ash and convey it to the fly ash silo.
The fly ash collected in several sets of ESP hoppers, Eco hopper, APH hopper and cyclone shall be conveyed sequentially by pressure type pneumatic conveying system through a pipeline to RCC silo.
The ash from the hopper shall be discharged into the transmitter vessel by gravity.
Required flow of compressed air shall be supplied at the transmitter vessel to convey ash to the storage silo.
The conveying air shall be vented to atmosphere through bag filter / vent filter mounted on silo top.
Shifting of ash clearance cycle from one hopper to the next shall be automatic and based on level.
Normally the ash evacuation shall be done continuously for 8 hours in a shift.
The system shall be sized such that fly ash generated in 8 hours can be evacuated in 4 hours.
The air compressor sizing and the pipeline sizing shall be done to suit the same.

2.3.0 Disposal of Bed Ash from Silo (By Others) Bed Ash storage silo has a capacity to store bed ash generated by 1x200 tph boiler and 1x250 tph boiler for 48 hours.

Silo has three (3) outlets of which 2 outlets are provided with rotary feeder for unloading of ash either in dry form into closed trucks using telescopic chute or in conditioned form into open trucks.
The third outlet is provided with blind flange for future use.
2.4.0 Disposal of Fly Ash from Silo (By Others) Fly Ash storage silo has a capacity to store fly ash generated by 1x200 tph boiler and 1x250 tph boiler for 48 hours.

Silo has three (3) outlets of which 2 outlets are provided with rotary feeder for unloading of ash either in dry form into closed trucks using telescopic chute or in conditioned form into open trucks.

The water shall be further connected to various consumption points as per the below,  Tap-off to RO-DM Plant  Tap-off to ACW Cooling tower  Tap-off to Service water and potable water application.
UF-RO-MB Plant The required Filtered water required for the proposed power plant shall be taken from existing water treatment plant.
The filtered water shall be made available at a distance of 1 M from the proposed DM water plant.
The EPC Vendor has the check the adequacy of pressure at terminal point, if required booster pump shall be provided.

The water shall be treated further in demineralized water treatment plant (DM plant) and it shall provide make-up water of specified quality and quantity to meet the feed cycle makeup of the 35 MW and 45 MW units and also the process steam supplied to the Chemical plant.
The DM plant consists of Ultrafiltration plant, Reverse osmosis plant and mixed bed polishing units.
The filtered water analysis is provided in the General Technical Specification.
The filtered water shall be treated in UF streams and the treated water from UF shall feed to the UF product water tank.

From Product water tank, the product water is fed to FCE-3118141-ME-DOC-SPC-3000-001, Rev 0 Detailed Technical Specification - Mechanical FICHTNER INDIA Volume - II Section -2 Page 2 of 53   3.2.3 3.2.4 3.2.5 3.2.6 3.2.7 3.2.8 35 MW & 45 MW Captive Cogen Power Plant Tender Specification for EPC Cartridge Filters by means of RO feed pumps.
The UF backwash waste is led by gravity to waste water collection tank.
The back flush pumps along with chemical dosing system as per the manufacturer recommendation shall be provided for UF system.
From the Ultrafiltration product water tank, the pre-treated water enters the cartridge filter for further reducing the suspended solids & turbidity.
In this line, acid is dosed to reduce the pH, Sodium Bisulphite is dosed to eliminate any traces of chlorine and Antiscalant is dosed to reduce the scaling effect on RO membranes.
The Silt Density Index (SDI15) at the outlet of cartridge filter shall be limited to less than 3.
The SDI shall be checked once in a shift to verify the quality of water.
Temperature, pH, ORP & SDI analysers are provided downstream of the Cartridge Filters to check the water quality along with an auto dump valve to prevent any off-spec water from entering the RO unit.

Water, thus treated is then pumped using inline RO High Pressure pumps through the Reverse Osmosis units where the dissolved solids are rejected and the permeate water is led to a RO product tank through degasser tower.
The reject water is led to a Reject Water Tank from where it shall be further pumped to Existing Effluent treatment plant.
From RO Product Water Tank, water is pumped to mixed bed ion exchanger unit using MB Feed Pumps.
The Mixed Bed Exchanger contains both Strong Acid Cation and Strong Base Anion resins.
Any slip of cations and anions from the RO and Degasser is exchanged and removed in Mixed Bed Exchanger, which acts as a polisher unit.
Hydrochloric Acid and Sodium Hydroxide are used for regenerating cation and Anion Resins respectively.
The Demineralized water thus generated shall be led and stored in DM water storage tanks.
Resin Traps are provided in rinse outlet and process outlet of the Mixed Bed unit.
The Dilution water for regeneration of Mixed Bed Unit shall be Demineralized water from the DM storage tanks through regeneration pumps.
Regeneration system for the MB units consists of Acid & Alkali storage tanks, acid / alkali-measuring tanks, associated piping, ejectors etc.
Air blowers are provided to mix the resin in the mixed bed exchangers.
The regeneration chemicals are Hydrochloric Acid (HCl) and Sodium Hydroxide (NaOH).
Once regeneration is complete, the operator initiates neutralization and disposal activity.
The neutralizing pit also receives spillages, overflows and drains of chemicals in the area.
Regeneration waste from the MB units shall be led to the neutralizing pit in lined trenches for further disposal.
The regeneration waste from the MB units shall be generally self- neutralizing.
The neutralizing pit is in two compartments with acid and alkali proof lining.
Once a compartment of the neutralizing pit gets full, the neutralized effluent disposal pumps are started and kept in recirculation mode.
pH of the effluent is measured and acid or alkali is added as required from the Neutralization Chemical Tank.
The MB Air Blower is run to mix the dosed chemicals.
Once the pH value comes within the acceptable range, the neutralized effluent is disposed to guard pond by closing the recirculation valve and opening the disposal valve.
Horizontal centrifugal, self-priming type pumps are provided for this purpose.
The output product capacity of DM water (MB outlet) shall be 150 cu.m/hr and the upstream of all system shall be sized to cater the losses across various system.

Cleaning and Painting Any painting work (including surface preparation) on piping or equipment shall be commenced only after the system tests have been completed and clearance for taking up painting work is given by the consultant / Owner, who may, however at his discretion authorize in writing the taking up of surface preparation or painting work in any specific location, even prior to completion of system test.

However, at times of unfavorable weather condition, the consultant / Owner shall have the liberty to control the time period, at his sole discretion and / or to insist on recleaning, as may be required, before primer application is taken-up.

required for cleaning.

VALVES AND SPECIALTIES Codes & Standards The design, material, construction, manufacture, inspection, testing and performance of valves and specialties shall comply with all currently applicable statutes, regulations and safety codes in the locality where the equipment shall be installed.
The equipment shall also conform to the latest applicable standards.
Nothing in this specification shall be construed to relieve the Supplier of this responsibility.
Design and Construction The Contractor shall select valves and accessories which are suitable for the operating conditions of the systems.
The selected components shall meet the requirements of trouble free and safe operation under maximum load, part load and transient conditions.
Valves and accessories which are of a similar make, size and type shall be interchangeable with one another.
All valve bodies shall be of the same nominal size as the adjacent piping, unless otherwise required.

FCE-3118141-ME-DOC-SPC-3000-001, Rev 0 Detailed Technical Specification - Mechanical FICHTNER INDIA Volume - II Section -2 Page 35 of 53   6.2.2.4 6.2.2.5 6.2.2.6 6.2.2.7 6.2.2.8 6.2.2.9 6.2.2.10 6.2.2.11 6.2.2.12 35 MW & 45 MW Captive Cogen Power Plant Tender Specification for EPC All valves shall be arranged so that the hand wheel moves in a clockwise direction to close the valve.
The face of each hand wheel shall be clearly marked with the words 'OPEN' and 'CLOSE' and shall be provided with an arrow to indicate the direction for opening.
All valve bodies with the exception of rubber lined / coated valves shall be of steel or cast steel.
Stainless material shall be used for the spindles, cones and seats of all vales.
In addition, all manually operated valves shall have external rising spindles.
In the case of rubber lined / coated valves with diaphragms, care shall be taken to ensure that the diaphragms are adequate for the operational Waste pressure involved.
All valves and specialties shall be so located that they are readily accessible for both operation and maintenance.
Wherever necessary, the valve spindles shall be extended and an approved type of pedestal hand-wheel shall be provided at the next higher floor level.
The pedestals shall be fitted with chromium-plated scales and valve movement indicators for the main and bypass valves, where required.
Adequate greasing facilities shall be provided for all valve pedestals and extended operating spindle attachment.
Valves that are to be kept locked in full 'OPEN'/ 'CLOSE' position shall be provided with a non- detachable locking arrangement comprising a chain and padlock.
For handling heavy valves (or part of valves), eyebolts shall be provided.

All remote controlled valves shall be provided with limit switches in all cases where their open or closed position must be signaled to the control room and / or where these conditions must be fed to the interlock circuits for ensuring safe operation of the plant.
All auto valves shall be provided with a manual override hand wheel.
The solenoid control valves for pneumatic-operated valves shall be grouped together and fitted near the exchangers (e.g.
in distribution boxes).
These distribution boxes shall also contain the terminal strips for the solenoid valves and the terminal boards for the valve position signaling circuits.
The solenoid valves must be individually fused and also permit manual override directly at the solenoid valve.
All pump valves fitted on the discharge side shall be suitable for throttling.

FCE-3118141-ME-DOC-SPC-3000-001, Rev 0 Detailed Technical Specification - Mechanical FICHTNER INDIA Volume - II Section -2 Page 36 of 53   35 MW & 45 MW Captive Cogen Power Plant Tender Specification for EPC 6.3.1.3 6.3.1.4 6.3.1.5 6.3.1.6 6.3.1.7 6.3.2 6.3.2.1 6.3.2.2 6.3.3 6.3.3.1 6.3.3.2 6.3.3.3 6.3.3.4 6.3.3.5 6.3.3.6 Pumps of manufacturer's standard production type which are nearest to the exact pump characteristics required shall be used wherever practical.
Only proven makes and models supplied by pump manufacture having extensive experience are accepted.
The pumps for handling degassed water shall be of SS 316.
Associated bolts, nuts and washers are also to be of stainless steel.
Pumps handling raw water, clarified water, service water / potable water shall be of Cast Iron.
Neutralized Effluent Disposal pumps shall be corrosion-proof plastic against all possibly expected combinations of hydrochloric acid, caustic soda and the salts of both.
Dosing pumps for the supply of Chemical solutions shall be of the Plunger / Diaphragm type, with adjustable stroke and constructed generally in PP.
Valves and associated equipment shall have the same quality of material.
All pumps shall be fitted with dry-run protection, check and minimum-flow valves on the discharge and suction sides.
Pump Types Centrifugal pumps shall be used wherever possible.
Positive displacement pumps of rotary type shall be acceptable when handling viscous liquids and reciprocating pumps shall be accepted for chemical dosing and metering purposes.
Design and Construction All pumps shall be designed to withstand 1.5 times the pump shut-off pressure, under maximum suction pressure conditions.
Pumps shall be designed for 110% of nominal flow and shall be capable of atleast 10% head increase at rated condition by installing new impeller.
Best efficiency point for rated impeller diameter shall be on the right side of the rated capacity.
All pumps shafts shall be of ample size to transmit the full output from their drivers.
The drivers shall be rated for the maximum power requirement of the pumps.
For motor driven pumps, the rated flow and head shall be achieved with a variation of ±10% in voltage and ±5% in frequency of the power supply.
Renewable wear rings shall be fitted to the casing and impeller.
All pumps shall be constructed of materials specifically designed for the conditions and nature of the pumped fluid and to resist cavitation, erosion and corrosion.
Teflon Bellows (GFT / Ceramic) shall be provided for pumps.
The seal provided shall be of approved make and it shall have inter changeability with other makes of equivalent standard.
The arrangement of the pump glands and mechanical seals shall permit repacking or fitting or replacement seals, with minimum of disturbance.

FCE-3118141-ME-DOC-SPC-3000-001, Rev 0 Detailed Technical Specification - Mechanical FICHTNER INDIA Volume - II Section -2 Page 37 of 53   6.3.3.7 6.3.3.8 6.3.3.9 6.3.4 6.3.4.1 6.3.4.2 6.3.4.3 6.3.5 6.3.5.1 6.3.5.2 6.3.5.3 35 MW & 45 MW Captive Cogen Power Plant Tender Specification for EPC Centrifugal pumps shall preferably be of the horizontal shaft type unless specified otherwise.
Each horizontal pump shall be mounted with its driving motor on a combined bed plate of rigid construction.
The bed plate shall be complete with drip tray fitted with a drain plug.
Bed plate material of construction shall be mild steel.
Vertical shaft centrifugal pumps may also be employed.

Centrifugal pumps shall be of rigid shaft design and shall be designed such that the first critical speed of the pump, when coupled to its driver, is at least 10% higher than the maximum operating speed.
The shaft diameter and distance between two consecutive bearings must include a sufficient margin to satisfy this condition.
The entire rotor assembly shall be statically balanced and dynamic balancing of the impeller is required if either of the following applies: a.
Pump speed exceeds 1500 rpm, and impeller diameter exceeds 150 mm.
b.
Pump speed exceed 1500 rpm for pumps having 2 or more stages.
Pumps shall operate smoothly throughout the speed range in reaching their operating speed.
Where necessary the pumps are to be fitted with devices to ensure a minimum through flow.
Pump Characteristics Where multiple pumps are installed for the same service, they shall be suitable for parallel operation.
The pump head characteristics shall be such that the head shall continuously increase with decreasing flow quantity with a maximum head reached at zero flow.
Generally a head increase of 15% above the duty point to no flow shall be acceptable.

Full pump characteristic curves giving differential head vs. capacity, efficiency vs. capacity, power absorbed vs. capacity, net positive suction head required vs. capacity shall be provided for all pumps.
Fittings All pumps shall be installed with isolating valves, a discharge non-return valve and discharge pressure gauges unless otherwise stated.
All positive displacement pumps shall be fitted with a discharge relief valve.
Pulsation dampers shall be provided on the discharge piping.
All couplings and any intermediate shafting shall be supplied with removable type coupling guards.
Couplings must have a rated capacity of at least 110% of maximum power transmission requirement.
Air release valves shall be fitted to all pumps at suitable points on the pump casing unless the pump is self-venting due to the arrangement of the suction and discharge nozzles.
Drainage facilities shall be provided on the pump casing or adjacent piping to facilitate the dismantling of pumps.

Bearings All bearings shall be of ample surface area and for large pumps shall be of the automatic oil lubricated sleeve type.
On pumps utilizing ball or roller bearings the inner race shall be fitted directly on to the shaft and positively located by a Sheller on the shaft.
Bearings on vertical shaft pumps shall be spaced to prevent vibration under any mode of operation.
Bearing housing on horizontal shaft pumps shall be designed to enable the bearings to be replaced without removing the pump or motor from its mounting.
Outboard bearing shall be double roll ball bearing and inboard shall be roller bearing.
Bearing housing on horizontal shaft pumps shall be effectively protected against the ingress of water, pumped fluid and dust with suitable non-ferrous deflectors.
All bearing oil wells shall be fitted with visual oil level indicators.
Non- pressure oil lubricated bearings shall be equipped with constant level oilers.
Means of draining bearing housings shall be provided.
Blowers Roots type blowers shall be equipped with air filter; safety valve; solenoid valve to open the drain when the blower is out of operation; and silencers on the intake and delivery sides.
The output and discharge head of the air blowers shall be determined by the Contractor.
Minimum discharge head shall be 4 mwc.
Anti-vibration mountings and cork insulation as well as flexible pipe joints on the discharge sides and surge vessels etc.
shall be provided as required.

10) All necessary facemasks, fire jackets, breathing and resuscitation apparatus and/or other protection devices for optimal protection of the personnel of fire station equipments.

11) Passive fire protection measures such as fire barriers for cable galleries and shafts etc., fire retardant coatings, fire resistant penetration sealing for all openings in floors, ceilings, walls etc., fire proof doors etc., shall be provided to prevent spreading and for containment of fire.

12) Contractor shall obtain all necessary clearances from authorised agency for fire protection and detection system interact with approving agency through Insurance Company or directly for getting the design and the installation approved.
